content.user_title: Complete Development Branches with Git Workflow
content.value_statement: AI assistants often complete implementation tasks but lack structured guidance for integrating work back into the repository. This skill provides a step-by-step workflow for verifying tests, presenting merge and PR options, executing user choices, and safely cleaning up worktrees.
actual_capabilities: Verifies tests pass before presenting integration options
Determines base branch using git merge-base
Presents four structured options: merge locally, create PR, keep branch, or discard
Executes git operations for branch checkout, merge, push, and deletion
Creates pull requests with GitHub CLI using heredoc templates
Cleans up git worktrees after branch completion
limitations: Only guides post-implementation workflow, not actual code changes
Focused on merge and PR patterns, not rebasing or complex history rewriting
Requires existing git repository with committed changes
Supports standard git commands only, not Subversion or Mercurial

best_practices: Always verify tests pass before presenting merge options to prevent broken integrations
Require explicit user confirmation before discard operations to prevent accidental work loss
Present exactly the four structured options without adding extra explanations
anti_patterns: Skipping test verification before presenting options leads to broken merges and failing PRs
Using open-ended questions like 'What should I do next?' creates ambiguous workflows
Automatically cleaning up worktrees without checking the selected option risks losing needed context

faq.question: What does this skill do?
faq.answer: It guides AI assistants through completing development work: verify tests, present merge/PR options, execute choice, cleanup worktree.

faq.question: Does it make decisions automatically?
faq.answer: No. The AI presents options and the user chooses. The skill only executes the selected workflow.

faq.question: Which git providers are supported?
faq.answer: Standard git commands work with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket. GitHub CLI commands specifically support GitHub workflows.

faq.question: What happens to my worktree?
faq.answer: Worktrees are cleaned up after merge and discard operations. For keep-as-is option, the worktree is preserved.

faq.question: Can I use this with feature branches?
faq.answer: Yes. It works with any git branch workflow. It determines the base branch and handles the completion process.

faq.question: What if tests fail?
faq.answer: The skill stops and reports failing tests. It does not proceed with merge or PR creation until tests pass.
